body_content.explanation: not easy to bend, cut, or break:
examples: a hard surface
There was a heavy frost last night and the ground is still hard.
Heating the clay makes it hard.

body_content.explanation: difficult to understand, do, experience, or deal with:
examples: There were some really hard questions in the exam.
It's hard to say which of them is lying.
It's hard being a single mother.
Her handwriting is very hard to read.
He's a hard man to please.
The topics get harder later in the course.
I feel sorry for the kids, too - they've had a hard time.

body_content.explanation: needing or using a lot of physical or mental effort:
examples: Go on - give it a good hard push!
It was hard work on the farm but satisfying.
You have to be quite hard to succeed in the property business.
Ooh, you're a hard woman, Elaine!
Our boss has been giving us all a hard time at work (= making our time at work difficult).
Life can be hard at times for these nomadic people.

body_content.explanation: to criticize someone severely, or to treat someone unfairly:
examples: Don't be too hard on him - he's new to the job.

body_content.explanation: A hard drink contains a high level of alcohol:
examples: Wine, beer and hard liquor can be purchased only at state-run liquor stores.

body_content.explanation: Hard water contains a high level of minerals that prevent soap from cleaning.

examples: hard facts/evidence

body_content.explanation: used to describe a time when there is bad weather:
examples: We had a very hard winter last year.

body_content.explanation: with a lot of physical or mental effort:
examples: Work hard and play hard, that's my motto.
I'm not surprised he failed his exam - he didn't exactly try very hard!

body_content.explanation: If it rains or snows hard, it rains or snows a lot:
examples: It had been raining hard most of the afternoon.
